children.subject: Since this is the one time L&S allows you to make a late change, they seem to be fine with students going under the 13-unit minimum. However, students who receive financial aid should verify this is OK w/ financial aid advisors, international students should talk to BIO, & student athletes should speak with their advisors.
Hi Lydia. I did my late drop on Friday. However, the course still shows up on my schedule. What can I do about this?
Can we use this form to drop a non CS class even if that would put us below the L&S 13 unit requirement to be a full time student? I am an international L&S CS student

The majority of the advisors are organizing an event on Friday or out of the office. Carol opened some appointment times on Friday, so she may be available, but if CalCentral is saying there is nothing, you may be out of luck. We send out the deadline reminders ahead of time to help students plan and avoid last-minute changes. Next time, I recommend meeting with us in advance, even if you're not yet sure about what you're going to do, so that you give yourself more options.

maybe we could obtain a digital signature? or just show up at some hour when advisors have appointments, hope that someone has finished their appointment early and get it signed? it shouldn't take long, right? I understand that it was our responsibility to check available times, and I am sorry that I didn't, but I really need this drop...

You can try emailing us the form to cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. You must give us background on your situation, i.e. why you are requesting the late change, and we will do our best to get the form back to you in time.

Please don't assume these requests are quick and "only need" our signature. We have to have a conversation with each student about their unique situation before moving forward.

Please also do not show up without appointments or outside of drop-in hours. We are the biggest department on campus and need time to work on projects, answer emails, take calls, etc., which is why we have our system for seeing students. Again, most of us are unavailable on Friday so emailing is best.
Apparently CalCentral just updated the available appointment times, and I was able to secure one on Friday. Thank you, and apologies for the last-minute inconveniences.
Thanks for the headsup anon! I got one as well. Sorry for the troubles.

Is there a way to get an appointment with an advisor before Friday? Calcentral only shows availability starting next Tuesday. I only decided to late drop just now so I missed the drop in hours on Wed.

history.content:
Dear Students,

This is a reminder that you have until this Friday, May 3 at 4PM to submit any late change requests (drop, add, grading option change) to L&S in 206 Evans. 
If you are declared CS: you must have a CS advisor sign the form before 4PM on Friday in order to submit this to 206 Evans. 
If you are not yet declared: you do not need a CS advisor's signature, however we recommend speaking with one of us before you submit to L&S, especially if the late change is concerning a CS class.
 
If appointments in CalCentral are already full this week, come to drop-in hours on Wed: 10-12PM & 1-4PM in 349 Soda.
Remember: You only get to use this late change option (for up to two actions, e.g. add a class and drop a class) during one semester. If you use this option in Spring 2019, you will not have this option going forward. If you have already used this option in a different semester, L&S will not accept another request.
history.subject: L&S deadline to make late changes to schedule: Friday, May 3 at 4PM!
